snippet: While Maryland became the 18th state in the country to abolish capital punishment, other states are trying to speed up executions.
abstract: Editorial welcomes decision by Maryland Gov Martin O'Malley to sign law making life without parole the state's maximum sentence, making state the 18th to abolish capital punishment; contends consensus is building that execution is an indefensible, archaic tool of vengeance.
lead_paragraph: While Maryland became the 18th state in the country to abolish capital punishment, other states are trying to speed up executions.
